org.opends.server.replication.server

Class SafeReadExpectedAcksInfo

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.opends.server.replication.server.ExpectedAcksInfo
      • org.opends.server.replication.server.SafeReadExpectedAcksInfo

  • public class SafeReadExpectedAcksInfo
extends ExpectedAcksInfo
    This class holds every info needed about the expected acks for a received update message requesting assured replication with Safe Read sub-mode. It also includes info/routines for constructing the final ack to be sent to the sender of the update message.

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from class org.opends.server.replication.server.ExpectedAcksInfo

    • Constructor Detail

      • SafeReadExpectedAcksInfo

        public SafeReadExpectedAcksInfo(ChangeNumber changeNumber,
                        ServerHandler requesterServerHandler,
                        java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> expectedServers,
                        java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> wrongStatusServers)
        Creates a new SafeReadExpectedAcksInfo.
        Parameters:
        changeNumber - The change number of the assured update message
        requesterServerHandler - The server that sent the assured update message
        expectedServers - The list of servers we want an ack from (they are in normal status and have the same group id as us)
        wrongStatusServers - The list of all servers already detected in wrongStatus (degraded status) to keep trace of the error for the future returning ack we gonna compute

    • Method Detail

        public void setHasTimeout(boolean hasTimeout)
        Sets the timeout marker for the future update ack.
        Parameters:
        hasTimeout - True if some timeout occurred

        hasWrongStatus - True if some servers were in wrong status

        public void setHasReplayError(boolean hasReplayError)
        Sets the replay error marker for the future update ack.
        Parameters:
        hasReplayError - True if some servers had errors replaying the change

      • processReceivedAck

        public boolean processReceivedAck(ServerHandler ackingServer,
                         AckMsg ackMsg)
        Process the received ack from a server we are waiting an ack from.
        Specified by:
        processReceivedAck in class ExpectedAcksInfo
        Parameters:
        ackingServer - The server handler of the server that sent the ack
        ackMsg - The ack message to process
        Returns:
        True if the expected number of acks has just been reached

      • createAck

        public AckMsg createAck(boolean timeout)
        Creates the ack message to be returned to the requester server, taking into account the information in the received acks from every servers.
        Specified by:
        createAck in class ExpectedAcksInfo
        Parameters:
        timeout - True if we call this method when the timeout occurred, that is we did not received every expected acks in time, and thus, the timeout flag should also be enabled in the returned ack message.
        Returns:
        The ack message ready to be sent to the requester server
